title: Our Thunderbird crashes regularily both on PC and MacOs
content:
We are using Thunderbird as our mail software and have for years. We have also donated regularly to Mozilla. We are using Thunderbird both on MacOs Monterey and Windows 10.

We can restart Thunderbird and it will open instantly and we can continue using it until next crash. We use English and Icelandic dictionaries. Else we use just Addon Compatibility Check extension.

We can't imagine why this is happening. We like Tunderbird and we do use folders and subfolders for sorting our emails. We have gone through "Repair folder" on all the folders we use.

We need to find out what is causing this steadily crashes or another email software with the hope that we can work without this daily problem.

Looking forward to your reply at your earliest.

Einar Erlendsson, CEP [removed email from public]
creator: einar7

title: Mail that I mark as Junk doesn't get moved to the Junk Mail folder
content:
I've been troubleshooting an issue where email from one user, Garry, gets moved to the Junk Mail folder. I have a sub-folder of Garry named "JunkMail". I'm not certain but I think that I must have created it for troubleshooting the issue with Garry's emails going to Junk Mail. I refer to that folder as GJunk. Here's what I need to understand better: 1. Is it possible that TB, not I, created GJunk? 2. Regardless how it was created, will emails that I mark as Junk and ones that TB automatically classifies as Junk, be moved to GJunk? 3. I think that there are some folders that TB creates automatically, right? Like Inbox, Trash, Sent. Is JunkMail another of those folders that TB creates automatically?

For troubleshooting, I sent an email to myself and marked it as Junk. It didn't get moved anywhere, it's still in Inbox. Later I sent another email to myself. It didn't get automatically marked as Junk.

Thanks for your help. SweetTasha
creator: sweettasha

title: Thunderbird with GoDaddy/Microsoft - asked for password and now folders and emails are gone
content: Hi, I am not very tech savy, so please pardon my ignorance. We use Thunderbird for our email client for our business email. Our email address is hosted through Go Daddy. Not long ago we were required to switch settings to utilize Microsoft365 to access email. We had someone that is in the tech business set it up for us. It has worked fine for up to now. (The person that set it up for us is out of the country for a week or yes, I would have him help me). Today we cannot access email without entering a password. It said that it didn't work. I went straight to GoDaddy to login to email to check to be sure that I had the correct password. (It opens a Microsoft window now where it used to log in to Webmail.) I was able to login with the password that I have. So, password must be good. I chatted online with Go Daddy and the tech had me remove my email from thunderbird and re add it. Once that was done it wouldn't sync. we tried several configurations. Finally after trying a few options in the settings I am able to receive NEW email, but most prior mail is gone along with all of my folders. It doesn't matter where I login to email now, via thunderbird or directly through Go Daddy/Microsoft, I am only seeing new emails and all folders are gone. Is there any suggestions to try?
creator: Cindy40

title: Thunderbird goes "Not Responding" and Looses focus in the process
content:
Thunderbird goes "Not Responding" and Looses focus in the process. That feature is getting quite annoying especially when I am in the process of writing a news email. The new email is loosing focus which is highly annoying, the Thunderbird mail client itself is not gaining the focus either. If I have other programs open it hides behind those.

Is there any weay to fix this, any tricks to avoid it from loosing focus?!?

I would be really grateful if there is a fix to it.

Regards Heinrich Christiansen
creator: olfred1966

title: Problem with upload mails from gmail to local pc using thunderbird
content: I'm using Thunderbird for the first time. The problem I have is following: I have about 6 GB mails stored in gmail. When I have start using thunderbird, I was able to upload automatically about 3 GB mails on the local folder of my computer. After that the automatic upload has stopped. When I click "Get message" button only 2 or 3 new mails are uploaded. Obviously this isn't solution for transfer of another 3GB mails from gmail. Wondering how to proceed further and what is the problem? I have about 150 GB free space on my pc. Thank you in advance for your advice and help
creator: nikola.chakarov
